title: Ticket #3664: Suspend and continue test - Waiting for fix
description:
job_basic_suspend_continue_test.run

One of the missing pieces are having suspend and unsuspend not be first class citizens in regards to registering callbacks and thus if they happen unexpectedly they become tests errors. The side benefit here will be we can ensure we get suspend and unsuspend events (10 and 11). The unclear side effect is that tests may fail which generated these events because they did not register them.

The basic test is simple enough. A 60 second sleep job is run with a suspend after claim run time > 20 and a continue if suspension time is > 20. If the job completes, it worked. Suspend and unsuspend events are passed in.

Would failure have job run forever? YES!

This test displays a bug in the shadow. Suspends are sometimes generating shadow exceptions. Sometimes we see it as a disconnect and the shadow tries to reconnect forever.
